businessProfile.name: Sam Jones BBQ
businessProfile.address: 502 W Lenoir St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 502 W Lenoir St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA

reviews.text:
Visited Sam Jones BBQ in downtown Raleigh and was pleasantly surprised!

As someone from Eastern NC, I‚Äôm usually skeptical of BBQ spots because too many places try to put a ‚Äúflare‚Äù on it. If you know Eastern NC BBQ, you know all you need is to cook it low and slow with a good vinegar-based sauce.

As an Offline member, I decided to give it a try‚Äîand I tell you what, I‚Äôll be back again and again! The BBQ was chopped perfectly and packed with flavor. Their house sweet sauce was delicious, and the vinegar sauce was just as good. They even had Texas Pete on the table, the music was right, and the sweet tea tasted like it had a whole bag of sugar in it‚Ä¶ just like an old school BBQ joint.

Side note: the baked beans were next-level‚Äîloaded with hamburger meat and onions, just like something you‚Äôd get at a backyard cookout. And let‚Äôs not forget the slaw! It‚Äôs rare to find really good slaw, especially on a sandwich, but theirs was spot on.

Ordering is done at the bar, and the service was amazing! I went at lunch when it wasn‚Äôt busy, and the staff was friendly, the restaurant was spotless, and my food was out before I even sat down.

This spot is the real deal. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

Stopped here for lunch with a big group. This place came highly recommended by family who lives just outside of Raleigh. We got a bunch of stuff so I got to taste a bit of everything. The wings and brisket were Amazing!!! The service was good, we sat outside so it wasn‚Äôt the traditional waiter taking order system. You have to order using a QR code and the food comes out. Everything was great, I think my expectations were a bit too high. The cornbread was awful! Only reason I‚Äôm taking away a star. If you‚Äôre going to have a smoke house, you have to get the cornbread right! Other than that, it was a good experience.

Solid BBQ here. The standout is the pork BBQ. Plenty of seating, but go early for best options and freshly roasted meets. Ribs, chicken, also good. Sides are generous, larger than some other places, so you‚Äôll have plenty to eat. Small parking lot adjacent. More street parking in the area. I‚Äôll be back to try the other items.

I did not enjoy my meal here at all. I came here and got the ribs with mac n cheese on the side. To start the ribs were not the usual smoked ribs that fall off the bone... they were pretty fatty and chewy. The cornbread was downright awful... it was not edible. The mac n cheese side was also not very good. I got the loaded baked potato as well which similar to the rest of my meal was flavorless. Very disappointing bbq food, even though the plate looked fantastic.

My new #1 BBQ joint in N.C.!  1st visit to the Raleigh location today and I was not disappointed!  That BBQ is phenomenal!  Right amount of smoke, vinegar and heat!  Sauces were awesome too! I‚Äôve had B‚Äôs, Bullock‚Äôs, Wilber‚Äôs, Stormin Norman‚Äôs, not to mention the Lexington Style places in Lexington and the Triad!  Sam Jones reigns supreme!  That‚Äôs a lot of praise being heaped on them too, for those not aware!  Slaw, potato salad, sweet potato muffin, fries, and tea!  ON POINT!  I can‚Äôt wait to get back!  It won‚Äôt come soon enough for me!  THE CHAMPS!!!

editorial_summary.overview: Easygoing restaurant preparing chicken wings, plus grilled poultry & beef sandwiches.

recentReviews.author: Kenneth Royce
recentReviews.text: I did not enjoy my meal here at all. I came here and got the ribs with mac n cheese on the side. To start the ribs were not the usual smoked ribs that fall off the bone... they were pretty fatty and chewy. The cornbread was downright awful... it was not edible. The mac n cheese side was also not very good. I got the loaded baked potato as well which similar to the rest of my meal was flavorless. Very disappointing bbq food, even though the plate looked fantastic.

recentReviews.author: m g
recentReviews.text:
Visited Sam Jones BBQ in downtown Raleigh and was pleasantly surprised!

As someone from Eastern NC, I‚Äôm usually skeptical of BBQ spots because too many places try to put a ‚Äúflare‚Äù on it. If you know Eastern NC BBQ, you know all you need is to cook it low and slow with a good vinegar-based sauce.

As an Offline member, I decided to give it a try‚Äîand I tell you what, I‚Äôll be back again and again! The BBQ was chopped perfectly and packed with flavor. Their house sweet sauce was delicious, and the vinegar sauce was just as good. They even had Texas Pete on the table, the music was right, and the sweet tea tasted like it had a whole bag of sugar in it‚Ä¶ just like an old school BBQ joint.

Side note: the baked beans were next-level‚Äîloaded with hamburger meat and onions, just like something you‚Äôd get at a backyard cookout. And let‚Äôs not forget the slaw! It‚Äôs rare to find really good slaw, especially on a sandwich, but theirs was spot on.

Ordering is done at the bar, and the service was amazing! I went at lunch when it wasn‚Äôt busy, and the staff was friendly, the restaurant was spotless, and my food was out before I even sat down.

This spot is the real deal. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

recentReviews.author: lenswork4
recentReviews.text: Solid BBQ here. The standout is the pork BBQ. Plenty of seating, but go early for best options and freshly roasted meets. Ribs, chicken, also good. Sides are generous, larger than some other places, so you‚Äôll have plenty to eat. Small parking lot adjacent. More street parking in the area. I‚Äôll be back to try the other items.

recentReviews.author: Scott Pugh
recentReviews.text: My new #1 BBQ joint in N.C.!  1st visit to the Raleigh location today and I was not disappointed!  That BBQ is phenomenal!  Right amount of smoke, vinegar and heat!  Sauces were awesome too! I‚Äôve had B‚Äôs, Bullock‚Äôs, Wilber‚Äôs, Stormin Norman‚Äôs, not to mention the Lexington Style places in Lexington and the Triad!  Sam Jones reigns supreme!  That‚Äôs a lot of praise being heaped on them too, for those not aware!  Slaw, potato salad, sweet potato muffin, fries, and tea!  ON POINT!  I can‚Äôt wait to get back!  It won‚Äôt come soon enough for me!  THE CHAMPS!!!

recentReviews.author: Dan Stepanukha
recentReviews.text: Stopped here for lunch with a big group. This place came highly recommended by family who lives just outside of Raleigh. We got a bunch of stuff so I got to taste a bit of everything. The wings and brisket were Amazing!!! The service was good, we sat outside so it wasn‚Äôt the traditional waiter taking order system. You have to order using a QR code and the food comes out. Everything was great, I think my expectations were a bit too high. The cornbread was awful! Only reason I‚Äôm taking away a star. If you‚Äôre going to have a smoke house, you have to get the cornbread right! Other than that, it was a good experience.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.0/5 rating from 5 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the perfectly chopped and flavorful BBQ, enhanced by delicious house sauces and authentic vinegar-based options. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The service is consistently praised for being friendly and efficient, with food served quickly even during lunch hours. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The sides, such as baked beans loaded with hamburger meat and onions, and spot-on slaw, are described as next-level and generous. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Negative feedback on the quality of cornbread and other menu items - review management can address this concern
Lack of awareness about the restaurant's ambiance and unique ordering system - social media marketing can improve this area
Competition and discovery issues due to limited parking - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
